Table of Contents

Name

prtreverse - create a CRUX package from files already installed on the system

Synopsis


prtreverse [-r] [-k] [-o] [-p] <portpath>

Description

prtreverse will build a CRUX package without recompilation, providing the package in question is already installed on the machine. The script will read the file list from .footprint file and create a package from corresponding files located on the hard disk. The created package will be saved in the port directory.

If a file listed in .footprint is not found, the execution stops with an error.

Owner/group and permissions are automatically adjusted to respect the list contained in .footprint. See OPTIONS if you need to change this behaviour.

If the corresponding package already exists, the script will not overwrite the file.

Options

-r
Uses files from /var/lib/pkg/rejected, when available.
-k
Keep working directory <path>/reverse.
-o
Do NOT adjust owner/group.
-p
Do NOT adjust permissions.
-f
Force creation of the package (overwrite existing package).

Examples

prtreverse -r /usr/ports/base/sendmail

Will build the sendmail package, using rejected files.

See Also

pkgmk(8)

Author

Simone Rota <sip@varlock.com>
